abstract: UnitedHealth says it will continue offering some of the popular consumer protections required by the federal health care law, even if the Supreme Court strikes down the entire law later this month.
snippet: UnitedHealth says it will continue offering some of the popular consumer protections required by the federal health care law, even if the Supreme Court strikes down the entire law later this month.
lead_paragraph: The UnitedHealth Group, one of the nation’s largest health insurers, announced Sunday night that it planned to continue offering some of the popular consumer protections required by the federal health care law, even if the Supreme Court declares the entire law unconstitutional later this month.

headline.main: Health Law Ruling Won’t Alter Plans by Insurer
headline.print_headline: Health Law Ruling Won’t Alter Plans By Insurer
